DMZdFLv-NtV5rPEs1U3e2w.text: This place is Fkg amazing. Having enjoyed some of the best tapas in Barcelona I am comfortable saying this. The food was imaginative and delicious but the the staff puts it over the top. No dish left us less than impressed. But our server, Joel, acted as sommelier, giving us the perfect experience. We cannot wait to return. Enough said.

RoKhJ6L4EcyPc0NHoyR3zw.text: Excellent food, drinks, dessert, and atmosphere. Wait staff is welcoming and friendly, attentive but not pushy. Definitely recommend a visit, and we would come again next time in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Baby lime trees all over the place!

hJ5vaZ8k3HZMndr6SxNXfQ.text: Absolutely brilliant. The only thing I am not so keen is u need to wait for ur friends then to be seats. However as they only have limited seats it show the equality. I enjoyed it.

E3DTIh-lCyeymVQpd4ADEg.text: We went to the Dury Lane's Barrafina because we couldn't find and nice restaurant in the Covent Garden area. We checked the reviews on Yelp and decided to test this place : we were not disapointed at all. The food is really excellent (special mention to the poached duck egg on brioche) and comes quickly and the staff is really kind. You sit at the bar around the kitchen but it is not to noisy and it's cool to see all your food being cooked under your eyes. Contrary to some reviews, we went there at 8:30 p.m. and we didn't wait at all (I guess it was not a busy day). The place and the atmosphere are very nice and pleasant. We would definitely recommand this place and we'll certainly be back during our next stay to London.

CqN7rkbSJ_2e1Zf_WAmaeg.text: a lot of people warn of the food in london but they all need to eat here. really amazing food...tried 7 dishes and all were explosion of flavors in my mouth. special shout out to the migas con morcilla. once you break the egg yolk and mix it, it triggers all the senses. the food here rivals any good restaurant!

m0gmnmWku6ii36MxAkwUpw.text: Fantastic experience at Barrafina. Very friendly staff. Original menu. Everything we tasted was delicious. We started with the Banderilla. This is a must have as is the Stuffed Courgette Flower. We also loved the chicken croquettes, cockles and the pork belly. We had the orange sorbet for dessert. So delicious. Would go back to experience everything else on the menu if we could!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

gYCII2cW4DqgAanaN0LE4Q.text: This was a highlight of our trip of 10 days. Each dish was expertly prepared and I can't recall any complaints. Service was excellent, the food equally matched. We had the salmon tartare, veal tongue, lamb kidney and lamb sweetbreads. If you've never had any kind of this stuff because it's just too weird - but are curious - the veal tongue would be a good starter. My girlfriend is the offal fan, I'm just along for the ride. I would dissuade those not used to organ meat from trying the lamb kidney, but the veal tongue is really good, even if you don't like that kind of thing. The only complaint I had was the street beggars while sitting outside. But I suppose you can't do much there. This will be a must visit for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Lamb kidney. Too weird for me, but my girlfriend who loves this kind of stuff thoroughly enjoyed it.
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Lamb sweetbreads. I'm not an offal fan much, but this was pretty good.
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Veal tongue. Melts in your mouth.

lcQp4pEnGA1iKr__dKx-yw.text: Fantastic food! Staff is friendly and they're fun to watch, but it was such an enjoyable experience. A gem for sure!

fnNd3vOz2w_bRJvGA6m-ag.text: Amazing meal on first day in London. Seated at bar immediately in front of head chef who finished each dish beautifully. What a treat!  Each dish we tried was outstanding.

CYEnhx6BKLlfa46HQHuVog.text: This was one of my favorite Spanish tapas spot in London. First off, I love Spanish tapas so i try to find the best one in every city I go. Barrafina serves traditional style tapas and every dish I got was spectacular. The flavors were bold, presentation was simple and clean and service was good. I really have nothing to complain. Its comfort food for me. Highlight:1. Squid ink rice 2. Corn fed chicken 3. Sangria

2WjTC-ULlLh3l8sLyvXpXw.text: Great food but prepare to wait and be in a tiny place. The experience and the food however makes the wait and the space worth it. Not kid friendly. We got the prawns, the pan con tomate, the gem salad, the chipirones, we closed with the tart of the day that was an apple tart with ice cream. All the food was great. The experience of being in the barra makes it really cool.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Prawns
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Pan con tomate
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Barra

nyDgKzZLX2bivVjR2cG-Zw.text: My favorite restaurant in London!Without a doubt the best tapas in London. Inventive, fresh, fun and reasonably priced. I love this restaurant. Look for the blackboard specials and order out of your comfort zone for the best experience. A warning, it gets crowded and its small. Waits can be upwards of an hour but it's totally worth it. Have a drink and talk to the people waiting next to you. I've met some awesome people just waiting to eat. Everyone talks to everyone, it's that kind of place.There are two locations. The Soho location is the original and the better of the two, but you can't go wrong with either.Enjoy!

VvTs-Nps8Un2QsZIesYVTA.text: This continuing from the review below because I ordered nearly the whole menu again...Crab bunOne who loves a moist burger like me will just fall in love this bun. It was incredible, a bit messy but worth scooping every last drop with your finger afterwards. The bun was so soft and airy it moulded into the shape of your fingers, topped with poppy seeds for that sweet peppery edge. Filled inside was a thick generous filling of crab in its rich sticky buttery bisque packed full of flavour and seasoning just right.Classic tortilla I did asked for the chorizo but they misheard and delivered the classic instead. As incredible as the texture was with its moist firm outside eggy layer breaking into a thick yolky filling of soften onions and potatoes, it somewhat lacked depth and flavour. It did call for a stronger ingredient in there to add some excitement to it and I believe chorizo would have been a fine pairing. I was impress by the skill to create such a delicate dish but mixed in with all the more flavoursome dishes I had beforehand I wasn't as impressed as I thought I would be.Roast milk fed lamb Wasn't very happy with the cut we were given as the meat along the side of the rib was much more compact and dense making it more more dry and stringy as I had hope. However much to my preference was the crispy skin that had been grilled so nicely it in the josper grill that it had crisp in its fat making it incredibly moreish. The little thin layers of meat in between each bone was much more rewarding too being moist and tender but of course that itself is not worth the £18.80 we paid for a little bit of skin and meatArroz con lecheSomething so simple like sweet chilled cinnamon in whole milk with rice was incredibly gratifying. Being quite thin and milky it was very light to enjoy, almost like a sweet soup and warming to the soul with the nutty spicy cinnamon.Cuajada This was another simple dish but also one that left me in awe. Similar to the texture of panna cotta but more natural being made of milk curd instead of gelatine and cream. It was incredibly creamy, subtle in flavour and gentle sweetened leaving room for the delicious thick chewy honeycomb to do the job. Being grainy, sticky and intense in its rich earthy sweetness, one little blob was enough to sweeten the whole dessert. Topped nicely with crunchy hazelnuts for that perfect contrast and nutty finish.There were a few dishes that really shone out in both quality and creativity in the kitchen however I didn't quite expect to enjoy it as less as I thought I would. I'm not sure if it was my taste preference or an off day. Don't get me wrong, the quality of the ingredients and cooking skills was definitely on par but I felt some dishes lacked depth or the combination of ingredients didn't quite match, overpowering some of the more delicate flavours. Their deep fried dishes are definitely their speciality though. Still I plan to visit another branch and see what the rest have to offer and what everyone is raving about

48FbvqeYYsJCdO19k68BSw.text: After knowing they opened this new location near my uni, I was so excited to eat Barrafina like everyday. I took my family friends over for dinner, but this location has really bad food compare to all other locations that I went (I tried all other locations various times, and they were all really good). We had some extremely salty tortilla, fishes, and other weird stuffs... So we ended up going somewhere else afterwards for food...

kB308DtB1nSlS6QnlGAj-A.text: Barrafina is know as London 's best tapas . Drury Lane is less famous than the Michelin star one in Soho. There is a very limited spaced and you sit in the bar around the kitchen. So go in group of 2 or 3 only.The food is absolutely amazing that I enjoy every single dish. I had crotaques , azro negro, crab bun and chorizo tortilla. The only thing that putsme off is the arzo negro! Rice, sauce and squid were cooked perfectly but too salty.. Food is served very quickly as soon as you finish a dish the next one comes right nextWorth the hype!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

ng1h158zxwemGKExmp2CWA.text: Yup, amazing! Wonderful food, wonderful staff, wonderful ambiance. Go there, it's worth the wait. Enjoy every moment of it. This is great food and well worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Oyster tempura. Yummy yummy.
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

67b3idjB7j2ZlH57e4KTVQ.text: Absolutely gorgeous food. The service was fantastic. The waiter was very attentive and willing to explain the menu in detail

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

TN5ZU6fF9rkjRTHaZlnxwg.text: We had just arrived in London after a very long train ride from Inverness.  After checking into our hotel my wife and I needed to get out and have some dinner.  We hadn't scouted the area nor had we planned any dinner reservations.  As is now my usual, I consulted Yelp within a mile radius and looked for reviews.  In this manner we decided to head to Barrafina.  We were fairly early for dinner and so we were easily able to get a couple of seats at the bar.  I guess I wasn't paying too much attention to the reviews, but I hadn't realized this was a tapas bar.  I know this sounds pretty stupid as in retrospect this should have been pretty obvious.  So in my tired and anxious state I felt pretty overwhelmed with the bustle of the restaurant and the fact that I wasn't sure how to navigate through the menu.  This is where the service shone.  Our serve was very polite and walked us through the menu and guided us through ordering an appropriate amount of food.  To the more sophisticated diner this may seem a silly point but I really don't enjoy going to a new restaurant and feeling like an idiot who doesn't belong.  So on that point kudos to the staff for their polite patience.   The food was simply fantastic.  Every course was a treasure.  Having got the hang of the place we just kept on ordering,  enjoying more and more of what the kitchen had in store for us.  I particularly enjoyed watching the food preparation in front of us as it gave us the entertainment for the evening.  We ended the meal with the cheese tray accompanied by a glass of Sherry.  I would definitely go back and in writing this think I just may before we fly home.

SQdxxnfdTuFYJAZAU98rgQ.text: Me and my cousins had about a 22 hour layover in London last October, basically to eat and rest, and by chance we found this place. Well worth the experience! The food was great, you get to watch everything they're doing, the seating was "bar/community" style and the place had a very cozy atmosphere. If I ever get the chance to go back to London, I'd definitely revisit!

7IDWZAL-Q50F4RV-Y17WVw.text: Busy little spot with great tapas. We had to wait over half an hour to get an actual table but we were able to order a few tapas dishes while we waited so it wasn't so bad.Dishes were small and expensive (~£7) but very yummy. My favourite dish: the croquettes!All the seats surround the kitchen much like a sushi bar so you get to see all the chefs in action. A good place to carry out your weekly splurge.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Tomato bruschetta
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Scallop ceviche
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Monk fish special

3vaEYQlWTY5W7pnhhPGrSg.text: Amazing tapas experience, with great food, service, and more great food!  Since it was our first time, our server described nearly every item on the menu patiently and enthusiastically, and told us when to stop ordering so that we have just the right amount to eat.  Everything, literally everything, was delicious and fresh.We got there early enough around 6 and waited around half hour prior to securing a seat for two.  By the time we left around 730, the line was winding around the periphery of the inside of the restaurant and the outside area was also jam packed.  I'd say well worth the wait.

9ItP6hAA4C9RropIRDcRuQ.text: Barrafina is everything I had been missing since I came back from a holiday in Barcelona, and this new restaurant is just as good as the other two. Food is simple, yet incredibly complex-tasting and cooked to perfection. The menu was carefully crafted to include everyone's Spanish favourites and is compelmented by an extensive "specials" board which are well worth a look. Is it expensive? Yes. But it's the best Spanish food you'll find in London and the food at Barrafina is well worth paying for.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Sardine on toast (daily special) at Barrafina Drury Lane
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Pimiento croquetas at Barrafina Drury Lane
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Chipirones at Barrafina Drury Lane

I1HFiAb9MARdbVhU2vMw9w.text: After 4 days of British food I needed a change. A friend has recommended this place and when I was thinking about what to do for lunch I happened to be in front of it. I was one of the first people in when they opened and grabbed a stool. It's only counter seating which a lot of the food prepared in front of you. The staff was very kind and informative. I ordered the Mediterranean prawns which were grilled while and excellent. The grilled leeks were good and in a vinegar sauce. The arroz negro was great. A large portion with a lot of squid. It had a large dollop of aioli which it didn't need. It was a tad too oily but very good. I recommend if you need a change of pace from British cuisine.

7rSlus7HJWqD6fhOipAY-Q.text: I came on the off chance the could seat me, as I'd been told its a must see, but they don't take bookings. It was pleasant enough, I had to wait half an hour to be seated but i was prepared for that! The staff were accommodating and squeezed me in round the kitchen bar area (no actual tables so you can watch the food being made). They had a large selection of tapas on the menu - not a great wine list however. Half of the specials board had sold out which was a shame, and it wasn't too late...only 9pm once I'd sat down. The food itself was delicious and very well presented, but I think my main complaint is that I left £40+ lighter, feeling like I could sill eat!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Menu
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Menu

LiIVM-Q44SYS_vOjtXZIow.text: Great spot, walked into the Drury Lane location while in town on business and really enjoyed the experience. It's a bit bright but really good food and wine. It's a very cool spot and would highly recommend checking it out.

4TZKEm5FJ481hhu7LKjb5A.text: 4.5 stars for the food. 4 stars for wait time and service.For one, I Love tapas style. Had to try this place for lunch when visiting London for meetings and play. I am glad we came here as the food was delicious and reasonably priced. I recommend Barrafina to all. Come hungry and try as much as you can.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

JqmWgiOCaaqLnisRQJH52g.text: This was an excellent meal all around. It was the favorite restaurant of our host and they talked it up quite a bit and it lived up to it.We were in a separate room downstairs since we were a big party. The food and service was great. My favorite was the scallops.

VAJT8lf_JbBL3vpyWcps_Q.text: My wife and I decided to go with the set menu for two and it truly was a feast for a king and queen! Way too much food for two people, but what the hell!  Started with pickled cucumbers, then a selection of meat filled dim sum (beef, venison and pork) then a selection of seafood dim sum. Everything was very tasty and unique. Then crispy duck, followed by a chicken and beef main dishes, and baby bok Choi. The paired desserts were equally fantastic. Glad our friends recommended that we try this place, it was great. Nice atmosphere downstairs, excellent service. We never felt rushed. Dropped a princely sum, but I'm sure we could have gotten a fantastic meal ordering a la carte. We just wanted the full experience. Enjoy!

kRU8LEMzu3hznqe0kq97Dw.text: Bar style seating only. This gives you a great view of how your food is prepared and how fresh all the ingredients are. The seafood empanada was super seafood tasty mostly squid and the black insides scare you a bit but I liked it. The tortilla and manchego was super cheesy. The mackerel was very oily the garlic bits were soo delicious be careful as there may be bits of bones. The oxtail was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Rabo de toro (oxtail) 12.8
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. mackerel special
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. seafood empanada 7.5

hwIvnMz3-Vnsahvw28LeZg.text: The grilled octopus.Really just anything from the sea. Veggies also very good. Mixed bag on beef/pork/chicken but everything fish was stellar,.Ended up here on consecutive nights cause dat octopus.

E5xE7p5Mip_kx_awydCo6w.text: This is a fun place. About 20 seats all around the kitchen and bar and you should be prepared to wait a bit. The good news is that you get drinks and appetizers while you are waiting. It was about 40 minutes and we sat down on a Wednesday night. We had several dishes ( maybe one too many) the soft shell crab was amazing and the chicken croquetas are worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Yum!!

DlvuccMtBYJ5T4cBIXl13Q.text: Beautiful food that took me back to my adventures in Spain. The waiter was from Madrid and was super knowledgeable about the dishes. He recommended some dishes to us and we tried something from almost every category on the menu. The food is tapas style, so each dish is served when ready. Everything had tons of flavor, with my favorites being the tomato salad and the prawn and manchego tortilla. Honestly just order randomly off the menu and you can't go wrong. Our servor said the arroz negro was his absolute fav but we didn't like it as much. It's very seafood-y and messy to eat. Will turn your entire mouth black. The inside was crowded so we ate outside on the patio/terrace. Some dishes are pricier than others, like the ham, and overall it's on the pricier side but the quality of the food is there.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Tortillita de Camarones
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Prawn and Manchego Tortilla
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Arroz Negro and Tomatoes, Broad Beans and Queso Fresco salad

I3dWmJT5HpAQcJo3Gt2wMg.text: So happy I got to get in!!! Like it a lot and would coke back if I had more time in london.

W8mpUL5k0CWvbm9ma1CwFQ.text: Barrafina fell short of expectation. Upon entering the restaurant, there is essentially a large bar which probably sits close to 20. The room is clean and lit well with white walls abound. I loved the fact that all the diners get to sit so close to the action. You can see all the cooks working at their various stations which is always a sight to see. While I am no expert when it comes to tapas, I found most of their dishes quite monotonous. We ordered quite a variety of dishes and found that they all had very similar flavors and textures. No dish really stood out except the soft shell crab with its play on an Asian classic that included soy and green onion. The "tortilla" was pushed hard to me by our server as one of their best dishes but I found it to be quite bland with its mushy potatoe filling and soft exterior. Other dishes we got included pork belly which lacked the melt-in-your-mouth texture we are used to and a fried tuna dish which tasted mostly like oil. The chicken croquetas were well executed and are worth getting.

ZlPd1-h91Uzy_sB0JtXZNQ.text: Muy bueno! No disappointments here! American diner style seating, and true Spanish style tapas. We stumbled on this place post theatre- open til 11- so we didn't wait for a seat, but the place was still hoppin'.  100% worth a wait tho... deelish!

Hb_ba5g0gaw1CJAd6xKhSg.text: Barrafina is one of those must-try restaurants in London. There have been so many great reviews about this tapas restaurant and I simply could not restraint myself from not trying it when I am in town.  As they do not take reservations, we tried to avoid the long lines by visiting the newest of the three locations (the one on Drury Lane) and also by walking in at 9pm for a late Sunday dinner, hoping that no one would "compete" with us  (they closed at 10pm). As we walked into the restaurant, there was a line with at least 5 parties ahead of us and we were told that there is no guarantee for a spot as people were not leaving. We prayed so hard as we waited and we were so very lucky to get a spot around 9:30pm. As all 4 of us sat down on the bar, we ordered so many dishes as if there was no tomorrow. The restaurant was closing and the last order was around 9:45pm. We ordered as many dishes as we could and every one of them were so tasty with wine. We were still eating while the staff was cleaning the stoves and ovens. Staff was all very friendly and attentive and they allowed us to order a dessert to finish off the dinner. We left the restaurant at around 11pm with an extremely happy and satisfactory stomach. It was so gooooooood!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

4FSPzcBP2LTD5_MBKv-MXg.text: An unforgettable, world class dining experience. With three top rated locations in London, Barrafina is an institution that prides itself on utilizing only the highest quality seasonal ingredients every day. The interior at this location in Covent Garden is elegant without being pretentious, with all seating situated in an L-shaped bar. The open kitchen allows you to watch the chefs work, and admire the displays of fresh vegetables and seafood that they work with. Great selection of Spanish wines, sherries, and Cavas. There are several vegan options on the menu, but be sure to ask your server about vegan specials, as they change daily. We started with wine and appetizers. I love that you can order as you go here, and try a variety of smaller plates. I got the Pan Con Tomate and the Padron peppers, both of which were expertly prepared traditional Spanish tapas. My favorite dish was one from the daily specials board-a Grilled Cabbage with Romesco sauce, made vegan without cheese. Roasted Marcona almonds, red peppers, tomato, and hazelnuts are blended to create a rich, earthy base for the tender cabbage. Do not skip dessert! We shared the Orange Sorbet, which was the best version of this dessert I have ever eaten. Served in a hollowed out orange, the freshly squeezed flavors were striking, packed with zest, and the perfect level of sweetness. The staff here are all lovely and very accommodating. I look forward to returning the next time I am in London.

eKwdfCGwVHjhVipsnnQBYg.text: I was quite impressed by this Spanish tapas restaurant. We sat directly at the bar and ordered from these lovely, friendly servers. We had:- Oxtail - Deliciously tender, pull apart savory goodness.- Squid ink rice - full of flavor, creamy, a definite must.- Mackerel - Got a little bit difficult due to amount of small bones, but overall quite good.- Caesar lettuce - Almost like a tiny caesar salad in a lettuce leaf. Innovative and refreshing.Everything was flavorful and very delicious. They don't take reservations and I would recommend not going with a very large party.

HNcLa9mKDvTN5bUNRU7y6A.text: I don't give many restaurants 5 stars, but this place definitely deserves it. Barrafina is a Spanish Tapas restaurant in London with a few locations. This was my first time there as we were traveling to London. The food was phenomenal and the experience was totally worth it. Highlights:- Small restaurant with seating for approximately 25. No reservations so come early or late. We showed up around 6pm and we waited for approx 30 minutes. However, we ordered some small plates and drinks prior to seating.- Prices were very reasonable and the dishes were unique.- Favorite were the Black Squid Ink Rice, Uni Special and Cured Meats. Highly recommend all 3.- Seating is open kitchen bar seating. Definitely a cool experience and something needed more of in the US.- All of the dishes were good so I would recommend going out of your normal comfort zone here if you see something you like!- We ordered 10 tapas for 2 of us totaling approx $100 USD. I would recommend 3 per person. Overall, this would be the #1 restaurant I would come back to in London. Even though it's not traditional London cuisine, the execution by the chefs is phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

BCQZOMYeZClTQRkv-mOV8w.text: This is probably the best gourmet Spanish I have ever had in my life, the place is small but while you are waiting for your table you can order wine and starters. A must go while in visiting London.

hhPwHWLOCx8OND8HsfevIg.text: The food here is rightfully respected as superior. Enjoy creative Spanish fare, with a regard for high quality and creativity. Be adventurous, the unknown is often the best.

JDmF3Ql0ROU_kvtbD48adg.text: This Spanish restaurant is a MUST visit whenever I'm in London (given I have time to queue). And now that I've moved here for a one year Master's program, I've somehow moved into a place just a minutes walk from their Drury Lane branch. Coincidence much?My must order every time is the Chorizo Tortilla (£9) with egg, chorizo, and potato slices. It's absolutely divine! Just seeing how the egg yolk seeps out as soon as you cut into it will put a smile to your face.As for the rest, I like their croquettes, jersey royals scrambled egg with iberico, pork belly, and their mussels/clams.The one disappointing dish would be their calamari which is fried perfectly but missing a dipping sauce.--voodie rating: 8.5/10--Per head £30+

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Pork belly
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Bomba Iberica. Like a fried meatball.
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom. Jersey royals, scrambled egg and iberico ham

LQXIfd-IvMtpMHfPMXzP2Q.text: Grilled octopus is awesome. Real tapas joint with the right accompanying manzanilla and hildaljo Barrafina is one block from the Royal Opera House and serves magnificent food at an L shaped bar with ~ 15 seats. Take one of those barstools and enjoy cold meats, seafood and dessert. Avoid the legion of tourist trap pizza parlors.

cJYve8aUOsriXS6tDHHqWw.text: Every dish was nicely presented.  We love the atmosphere and the food there.  However, husband said the red shrimp was not as fresh as we thought.  The chicken wings are so delicious. The black ink risotto is so tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom

1zBUomR3sWyJuUO7L-msEw.text: Such a fun place!  Sit at the counter and watch the cooking!  Friendly and helpful staff.  Food is amazing!  The octopus is the best I have had anywhere. Everything we ordered was wonderful and presented beautifully.  Would highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Barrafina - London, United Kingdom
